intro: Pipturus australium, commonly known as the southern holly, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Aquifoliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles, followed by red, fleshy berries that are edible for birds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Pipturus australium plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and maintaining forest biodiversity.
